channel.title: JAR Client Wont Connect?
channel.description:
I'm trying to .jar a client and every time i do it says, 'Error Connecting to Server' but when i run it from a batch file it logins perfectly. I have searched this but all i get is crap :/ If someone could help that'd be great, even for trying i'll rep+ you. Btw i have made the jar in 2 different ways. Using the JAR Maker and ZIPing all the files with winRAR (with creating a the manifest thing). Help Please?
PS. Can a Mod or Admin please move this to the 'Client Help' Section, accidently posted here.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 29, 2009, 02:13:09 pm[/size][hr]Bump?

item.title: JAR Client Wont Connect?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

There are other ways too, you can do it using

parameters.put("java_arguments", "-Xmx500m");
I believe, but you would have to use a hashmap.

Here are a few resources for you:
http://www.roseindia.net/javatutorials/javahashmap.shtml
http://www.docjar.com/html/api/java/util/HashMap.java.html

Java Examples - Java Program Sample Source Code – 1 Dec 11

Iterate through the values of Java HashMap example

This Java Example shows how to iterate through the values contained in the HashMap object.

Read full topic

item.title: JAR Client Wont Connect?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:7, topic:291728”]I fixed this problem ages ago, it needs to be lowmem to login from a jar file.
Or else it runs out of memory, you have to use a batch file to run the jar file,
in JARMaker check the generate .bat box at the bottom, and add -Xmx500m in the batch file,
like it is in the batch file to run the non-jarred version.[/quote]
My client loads high-detail, and no batch file. I ran myn from .class files though, into a .exe. There are converters for that ALL OVER, you will need to figure it out yourself though.

Read full topic

item.title: JAR Client Wont Connect?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

I fixed this problem ages ago, it needs to be lowmem to login from a jar file.
Or else it runs out of memory, you have to use a batch file to run the jar file,
in JARMaker check the generate .bat box at the bottom, and add -Xmx500m in the batch file,
like it is in the batch file to run the non-jarred version.

Read full topic
